flavor: The soul of a samurai is contained within his blade, and the eldest of each generation is blessed to carry the katana of his grandfather. It is an honor, and a burden.

"A Lion's blade found at the scene of a crime is more than an insult. It is a blasphemy of everything that we stand for, and everything that our ancestors worked to achieve during their mortal lives." - Matsu Fumiyo

title: A Samurai's Soul
flavor: "The katana is sacred to a samurai. It is believed that his soul is contained within the blade. As the sword is passed from generation to generation, imagine how many souls it must accumulate." - Tsi Soshu, Daimyo of the Oriole
text: (A Personality can only have one Weapon.)

title: A Samurai's Soul
flavor: The philosophy of the samurai is such that the katana represents the soul. No samurai will allow dishonor to come to his blade, on pain of death.

text: (A Personality can only have one Weapon.)
title: A Samurai's Soul

flavor: "Your land is cursed," said the pale-skinned wanderer. "We will help you cleanse it, Moto."

flavor: "I prefer my katana, but it cannot reach my enemies who sit astride great horses." - Matsu Kenseiko
He lowered the polearm toward me "Stand aside," he whispered. I clutched my katana and waited to enforce his demand.

Her polearm shining in the dimming sun, Tsukune watched the Scorpion begin their long journey into exile. "At last, Tadaka," she murmured, "you can find peace."
Her polearm shining in the dimming sun, Tsukune watched the Scorpion begin their long journey into exile. "At last, Tadaka," she murmured, "you can find peace."

"Kokujin!" I screamed, but it was too late. His hands were on Togashi's swords, and his lips cracked in a bloody smile. Then the traitor fled, back to the Shadowlands that had spawned him. One day, I swore, his treachery would be rewarded with death."

title: Naginata
flavor: Held in the same esteem as the daisho, the naginata is the samurai's preferred polearm. With a blade forged similarly to a wakizashi, expertly balanced, and offering superior reach, it is sometimes even favored over a samurai's own katana. For such a noble weapon to be in the hands of a commoner is strictly forbidden.

title: Naginata

flavor: "Not all those who have fallen in this war have fallen with their honor intact. It is painful, but we must remember their shame as well." - Miya Shoin

title: Record of Failure
flavor: "To even speak his name in remembrance fills my heart with shame, but for the sake of our family, I must do so regardless."

title: Heavy Yari

flavor:
Although the samurai favors his daisho above all other weapons, any competent warrior would never discount the many advantages of the yari. In the hands of the untrained, it is a viable defense against aggressive forces. In the hands
of a samurai, it is a tactical instrument of death.

flavor: The sword of a Tsi artisan is unparalleled in the Empire. Forged from seven layers of folded steel, often taking years to forge properly, an Oriole blade is the perfect expression of swordsmanship. One cannot even be forged without the blessing of an Emperor.

text: This Personality has Conqueror (A Conqueror's unit doesn't bow after battle).
title: Oriole Katana

flavor: To be noticed by the sun, one cannot stand in shadows.

text: This Personality has +1PH. You may use rulebook Favor abilities two times per turn. When this Personality Lobbies, add his Personal Honor to the Family Honor check. He may Lobby even if you have already Lobbied once this turn.
title: Regal Furisode

flavor: "Let them stare. This was my grandmother's weapon, and I carry it proudly!" - Utaku Sang-Ju

text: (Draw a card after you Equip a Destined card.)
title: Utaku's Destiny

flavor: A parangu is nothing more than a slashing tool, better suited to clearing brush than acting as a proper weapon. Wielding such a thing in a fight is distasteful, but desperate times breed desperate measures.

title: Reinforced Parangu
flavor: A crude, simple blade used by the Mantis for mundane affairs.
text: Battle: Fear 2 (Bow a target enemy Follower, or Personality without Followers, with 2 or lower Force).
Battle: Fear 2 (Bow a target enemy Follower, or Personality without Followers, with 2 or lower Force).
title: Reinforced Parangu

flavor:
Yogo Katsuta stared as his blood-streaked hand. "I don't… don't understand."
"Perhaps in the next life," Aranai said softly.
use: Armor, Yoritomo Aranai honorably spares a Scorpion
designernotes: Notes: Some solid dishonor meta.

text:
This Personality has Resilient.
Interrupt: After you Equip this Item, rehonor this Personality, and you may target and rehonor another Personality.
title: Aranai's Armor

flavor:
"Your life is mine now, little beast," Aranai said to the cowering goblin.
"Yes, yes!" Keppo sobbed. "Keppo do whatever warlord asks!"
use: Weapon, Yoritomo Aranai honorably sparing Keppo
designernotes: Art - Aranai hesitates as she raises her kama to strike down Keppo.

text: (Repeatable Interrupt: Discard a Courage card to give a Fear effect +2 or -2 strength.)
title: Aranai's Kama

flavor: "True craftsmen are in rare supply in the Colonies. However, the archer's skill is enough to compensate for poor work in some cases." - Tsuruchi Taito
designernotes: An old, well used Daikyu.

text:
(Draw a card after your Expendable card is destroyed.)
Battle, :bow:: Ranged 3 Attack.
title: Crude Dai-kyu

flavor: "Of course I would never consider actually using a gaijin weapon, even if it was one that I could make appear whenever I wished. However, contemplating the possible applications of such a thing is ... interesting." - Bayushi Makubesu
designernotes: A Gaijin sword from the colonies, encrypted with stranges encryptions and richly decorated. Looks ancient.

text:
(Draw a card after you Equip a Destined card.)
After this Weapon enters your discard pile from play, put it back into your hand.
title: Ensorcelled Longsword

flavor: "My ancestors have passed this weapon down since before the Ki-Rin Clan left the Empire. And you dare call us gaijin, Phoenix?" - Utaku Izimi
designernotes: Notes: A small magical knife that can hardly been seen.

text:
(Repeatable Limited, :g2:: Discard a Kharmic card to draw a card.)
In a duel, you may focus this Item from your discard pile and remove it from the game after the focused cards are discarded.
title: Heirloom Tanto

flavor: "Ninja!" Isas hissed. "I'm not," said Makubesu, "but I think my dagger is. Never fear; you both are in the custody of an Emerald Magistrate now."
use: Weapon, Bayushi Makubesu takes Tsuruchi Isas hostage
designernotes: An incredibly fast Ninja-to.

text:
After this Item enters play, lose 1 Honor.
Ninja Interrupt, :bow:: After each time your action targets an enemy Follower or Personality, give it -2F until after the action resolves.
title: Hidden Dagger

flavor: Masatsuko signed the writ with a heavy hand. There were times when even the Miya knew war was inevitable.
use: Designer's Choice, Miya Masatsuko take a captive hostage
designernotes: Notes: An honorable item, but a dishonorable act.

text:
Card effects will not straighten this Item.
Political Open, :bow:: Give this Item a number of Favor tokens equal to this Personality's Personal Honor.
Political Open, :bow:: Target a Personality. Discard two Favor tokens from this Item to negate his next straightening this game or five Favor tokens from it to bow him.
title: Official Sanction

flavor: True geisha do not consort with such low company that they would have to worry about defending themselves. Of course, that doesn't stop all of them from learning how.
designernotes: (Revised art: Shosuro Laserbeam throwing a sake bottle at a Lion. Flavor should have some comment making light of this)

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard a Courage card to give a Fear effect +2 or -2 strength.)
Battle, :bow:: Melee 2 Attack. Lose 1 Honor.
title: Opportune Weapon

flavor: The area around the Kitsu Tombs saw a surprisingly large amount of pilgrims as the Imperial bureaucracy debated the Lion's petition for war. When it was granted, the Lion realized too late just what those visitors truly were.
designernotes: Art - A shikomizue is a sword concealed in a simple bamboo walking staff. Art of a traveler drawing the blade from his walking stick while surrounded by ronin bandits.

text:
You may Equip this Item as an Engage action.
Battle: Fear 1, or Fear 2 if you Equipped this Item during this battle.
title: Shikomizue

flavor: To a true master, every opponent is but a student.
designernotes: (Art: A Toshimoko-esque Crane dueling teacher besting an opponent with a Bokken)

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard a Courage card to give a Fear effect +2 or -2 strength.)
Before this Personality wins a duel, negate the loser's destruction. After this Personality wins a duel, gain 1 Honor.
title: Shinai

flavor: Above all others, the Unicorn embraced the magic of the Colonies... much to the Phoenix's concern.
designernotes: A magic staff of gaijin origin.

text:
Engage: Give a target enemy card -1F.
Battle: Ranged 1 Attack.
Battle: Fear 1.
Battle, :bow:: Straighten this Personality.
title: Staff of the Raja's Court

flavor: "In the Colonies, the Spider were many, and the resources of the Crab were few," Renyu said to the Susumu. "Here, however, it is much different. Speak again, and I will help you understand this."
designernotes: A Weapon Rack full of Katanas.

text: Invest :g1:: Search your Fate deck for a Stockpiled Weapon, show it, and put it in your hand.
title: Stockpiled Weapon

flavor: It steals the souls of those it touches. Even, eventually, the wielder.
designernotes: A huge, sinister-looking no-dachi.

text:
On your turn, you must declare an Attack Phase and assign this Personality to attack, if able.
Battle, :bow:: Destroy a target enemy card with Force less than or equal to this Item's, and no attachments. Give this Item a +1F token.
title: Toshigoku's Blade

designernotes: 2011 tournament result.

text:
Cannot attach to a Scorpion Clan Personality. Equips to a Mantis Clan Personality for 1 less Gold. This Personality has Tactician.
Interrupt, :bow:: Negate an action from a Fate card with the same Focus Value as a card discarded by this Personality's Tactical Advantage action this turn.
title: Aramasu's Mask

flavor: "There are many secrets for awakening powerful spirits within the weapons of war. However, there are few that can be trusted to use such power wisely. Even a fraction of such might in the hands of the unworthy can cause immeasurable tragedy." - Asako Chukage
designernotes: Notes: A guy holding a Naginata while defeating an enemy in battle. Destiny is what he chooses it to be.

text: (Draw a card after you Equip a Destined card.)
title: Awakened Naginata

flavor: Yoritomo Kanaye laughed over the sound of the demon's flames. As arrow after arrow struck, the fire's roar became an agonized whisper.
designernotes: 2013 Kotei result. Yoritomo Kanaye take Moetechi no Oni hostage

text: Battle, :bow:: Give a target enemy Follower or Personality -4F.
title: Bishamon's Bow

flavor: "It's interesting, is it not?" Jekku said casually. "I found it in the gaijin lands. It seems quite useful, even if you are not a priest. What do you think of that, Jikaro-san?"
designernotes: 2013 Kotei result. Yasuki Jekku takes Shiba Jirako hostage

text: Battle, :bow:: Bow a target enemy card.
title: Bo of Ritual Blessings

flavor: Jiramu and Emoto had known it might come to this. The Seppun had been caught, and now there was only one way for him to convince the Kolat of his loyalty so that he might infiltrate them.
designernotes: 2013 Kotei result. Seppun Jiramu kills Yoritomo Emoto

text: Battle, :bow:: Melee 2 Attack (Destroy a target enemy Follower, or Personality without Followers, with 2 or lower Force).
title: Jiramu's Wakizashi

flavor: "Some of the smiths find themselves inspired, taking the time to make elaborate patterns on the weapons. So long as it doesn't slow production or keep it from killing something, I leave them to their choices." - Hida Kisada

text: Battle, :bow:: Give a target enemy Follower or Personality -2F.
title: Kaiu Axe

flavor: "Some secrets, some places are not even for you, Dragon," Sung-Ki said quietly as they rode away.
designernotes: 2013 Kotei result. Utaku Sunh-Ki takes Tamori Takeshi hostage

text:
This Personality has +1PH.
Battle: Fear 2 (Bow a target enemy Follower, or Personality without Followers, with 2 or lower Force).
title: Kikko

flavor: "I think on that moment every time I close my eyes. If there are Fortunes, it is certain they mock me." - Yoritomo Tansen
designernotes: 2013 Kotei result. Yoritomo Tansen kills En'you

text: Battle, :bow:: Ranged 3 Attack, or Ranged 4 Attack if the target is Shadowlands (Destroy a target enemy Follower, or Personality without Followers, with Force equal to or lower than the Ranged Attack's strength).
title: Osano-wo's Bow

flavor: "If you listen as it cuts through the air, it sings the names of those who have fallen before it. I believe the music will grow one breath longer soon." - Kakita Ibara
designernotes: Note: A Kakita's perfect blade.

title: Singing Blade
flavor: Drawing it from its scabbard creatures a single, perfect note, like the sweetest of music.
text: After this Personality wins a duel, give this Item a +1F token.
designernotes: Note: A Kakita's perfect blade.

text: After this Personality wins a duel, give this Item a +1F token.
title: Singing Blade

flavor: "How terrible is the Spider's wrath," Takuan noted casually, "if our mere monks can thwart beings from other Spirit Realms?"
designernotes: 2013 Kotei result. Omigawa kills Natsumi

text: Battle, :bow:: Melee 4 Attack (Destroy a target enemy Follower, or Personality without Followers, with 4 or lower Force).
title: Sohei's Ono

flavor: "Look at that," the Scorpion said. "Lion blood matches my kimono perfectly."

text: Battle, :bow:: Fear equal to this Personality's Chi that may target a Personality with Followers (Bow a target enemy Follower or Personality with Force equal to or lower than the Fear's strength).
title: Tested Blade

flavor: "I would prefer not to get your blood on my clothes, Lion, but if you are so eager..."

text:
(You may Equip a Reserve attachment, if it would be opposed, as a Battle action.)
After you Equip this Item, you may take an additional action.
title: Untested Blade

flavor: "But why name the blade after something so mundane?" Daitsu did not reply. He only smiled.
designernotes: This is Kakita Dean's katana.

text:
Equips to Kakita Daitsu for 1 less Gold.
Battle, :bow:: If your card bowed this Personality this battle, straighten him.
title: Taketori

flavor: The Otomo watched on in horror. The Kaiu cast him a glance. "You did say you wanted it done quickly."
designernotes: Crab Engineers using a monstrous contraption to demolish buildings in the Second City.

text:
This Item has -3F while it is bowed.
Siege Battle, :bow:: Melee 5 Attack.
Siege Battle, :bow:: Destroy a target Fortification at this battlefield.
title: Demolisher

flavor: "They say the talented hawk hides its claws." Hachiro brandished his Mai-Chong. "But then, I rarely argue with results."
designernotes: Hachiro on his war horse, his three pronged spear resting on his shoulder and over the back of his neck, the tip shining in the sunlight.

text:
Equips to Matsu Hachiro for 1 less Gold.
Battle: Fear 2, or Fear 4 if the target is a Follower.
title: Takatsume

flavor: "I have seen it turn aside arrows and crumple blades. But by Amaterasu's memory, is it worth it?" - Iuchi Chiwa
designernotes: A suit of heavy armor. Should really look super heavy.

text: Card effects will not move this Personality. Melee and Ranged Attacks targeting this Personality have -2 strength.
title: Iron Armor

flavor: "When in defense of my lord, I do not get picky!" - Kaiu Nakagawa
designernotes: A big ass, Heavy Weapon, striking down on some skulls.

text: (Draw a card after your Expendable card is destroyed.)
title: Forge Hammer

flavor: "I told you, it fell from the heavens! Who am I to question the Fortunes?" - Hiruma Maiko
designernotes: A massive hammer with mystical properties, channelling lightning, held up by a tall handsome samurai with a elaborate helmet on. Any stuff that could be vaguely reminiscent of Thor and that aren't out of touch with the setting are encouraged as easter eggs.

text:
Home Battle: If this Personality would be opposed, move him to the current battlefield.
Thunder Battle, :bow:: Melee 3 Attack.
title: Raiden O-Tsuchi

flavor:
"That cannot be the sword Saikatsu! It was lost when Otosan Uchi fell!"
The Shiba held the sword high above her head. "Then allow me to prove it to you."
designernotes: Notes - A weapon of great strength and brightness.

text: Melee and Ranged Attacks targeting cards in this unit have -1 strength.
title: Saikatsu

flavor: "It is much better suited for archery in close quarters, and will serve you well in the swamps. But you'll have to get very close." The scout's eyes narrowed. "Not a problem," he said.
designernotes: A POV view of a nocked arrow following the movements of its intended target, who is unaware they are being targeted.

text: Battle, :bow:: Ranged 2 Attack (Destroy a target enemy Follower or Personality without Followers with 2 or lower Force).
title: Tsuruchi Hankyu

flavor: "What does it matter? I was victorious! Isn't victory all that counts?"
designernotes: Notes - A card that could be great against dishonor, but can also come with a pretty hefty cost.

text:
This Weapon's Force Modifier is equal to the number of dishonorable Personalities you control, to a maximum of +3F.
Battle, :bow:: Dishonor your target honorable Personality. Straighten a target Personality.
title: Akumato

flavor: "My younger brother Daitsu has a fine blade, certainly, but only a true artist can wield Uguisu." - Kakita Shinichi
designernotes: This is Kakita Hank's sword (from ALS)

text:
Equips to Kakita Shinichi for 1 less Gold.
Interrupt, :bow:: If the action is from this Personality, its Fear effects destroy attachments after bowing them.
title: Uguisu

flavor: "How are they able to follow his signals in so much rain?"
designernotes: A Phoenix Samurai gesturing with the tessen towards enemy troops, while a great surge of water lifts an entire divison of Phoenix troops up in wave to crash down into the enemy ranks.

text:
Equips to a Phoenix Clan Personality for 1 less Gold. This Personality has Cavalry and Tactician.
Water Battle, :bow:: Move this Personality home. Straighten his unit as he moves.
title: Tessen of the Tsunami Legion

flavor: "Ah, such a painful sting, and yet they seek it so reverently." - Doji Takato
designernotes: A token of Iweko Miaka's affection.

text:
(This is not an Affection token for Iweko Miaka.)
Open, :bow:: Search your discard pile, then Dynasty deck for Iweko Miaka. If she is not dead, discard a card in one of your Provinces and refill it with her, face-up. Discard this Item.
title: Token of Affection

flavor: It is not enough to hammer mindlessly upon the metal. A true forger folds his very soul into the blade.
designernotes: A crude looking, unfinished sword laying on a anvil, still red hot having been just forged.

text: Invest :g1:: Gain 1 Honor. (Increase the Gold Cost by the Invest cost to get the effect, once.)
title: Unfinished Blade

flavor: "Such unevenly-weighted, disgraceful, ghastly weapons. They suit the Spider monks nicely." - Doji Dainagon
designernotes: Art: An action shot of a Spider Monk doing a jumping slam of his Bisento at his Samurai opponent. The Samurai attempts to block with his katana but it breaks under the attack.

text: Battle, :bow:: Bow a target enemy card. Destroy it if it is a One-Handed Weapon.
title: Bisento

flavor: Designed for farming, not fighting… although it is adequate for either purpose.
designernotes: A pair of kama.

text:
(Draw a card after your Expendable card is destroyed.)
This Item has +1F while this Personality is a Kensai.
Battle: Negate this Personality's current Force penalties.
title: Farmer's Kama

flavor: The samurai carrying the army's own standard has the most dangerous position on the battlefield. For many, it is a death sentence, yet so many still dream of the honor.
designernotes: A noble samurai in a huge battlefield with a back banner, leading a charge of his troops.

text: Fear effects targeting cards in this unit have -1 strength. Ranged Attacks targeting cards in this unit have +1 strength. While opposed, this Personality has +1PH and his Followers have +1F.
title: Ouma-Jirushi

flavor: What the Rokugani call "Gaijin Pepper" is strictly forbidden, since the time of Hantei the 8th.
designernotes: Barrels of gaijin powder.

text: Open: Destroy a target Holding controlled by a player with four or more Holdings in play. Lose 2 Honor. Remove this Item from the game.
title: Polvora Cache

flavor: Inspired by the rice thresher used by farmers, nunchaku are considered by samurai to be good only for training reflexes, hand movements, and standing balance. Most would never lower themselves by using a training weapon in a true fight.
designernotes: A Weapon used not by Samurai but by peasants, like a kama.

text:
After this Item attaches, dishonor this Personality.
Battle, :bow:: Give a target enemy Follower or Personality -2F.
title: Wooden Nunchaku

flavor: "To all scions of the Phoenix Clan, be aware that the Forgotten wave man calling himself the Banished has taken objects of incredible importance. He is to be found at all costs, and the items recovered. As the Banished has not seen the errors of his ways, his survival is not desired." - The Elemental Masters
designernotes: This is the box that Banished stole, but had to leave behind when he fled from the Phoenix. This should be the aftermath of the art of Banished above. We should see Banished fleeing the fight scene, and we see the box sitting there.

text: Your Personalities with this Personality's Family Name enter play for 1 less Gold.
title: Box of Secrets

flavor: If revenge is a beast, then surely this is its fang.

text:
(You may Equip a Reserve attachment, if it would be opposed, as a Battle action.)
After this Item enters play, if the last action another player took destroyed one of your cards, you may take an additional action.
Battle, :bow:: Melee 2 Attack.
title: Fang of Vengeance

flavor: Sometimes a mere reputation is enough to make a weapon terrible.
designernotes: A sweet Naginata.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard a Courage card to give a Fear effect +2 or -2 strength.)
Battle, :bow:: Melee 2 Attack (Destroy a target enemy Follower or Personality without Followers with 2 or lower Force).
title: Flawless Naginata

flavor: "I created it for the war against the Spider. No, I don't think the name is presumptuous. Why do you ask?" - Kaiu Watsuki
designernotes: A legendary jade tetsubo that has mysteriously reappeared as the forces of the Shadowlands are on the rise. Should be shown being wielded by Hida Toranosuke.

text: Will not attach to a Shadowlands Personality. This Personality has +1PH. After your turn begins, give this Weapon a +1F/+1C token.
title: Inevitable Victory

flavor: The Lion Champion stared at her older brother. "I wish only to serve you, sister," he said, smiling. "This conflict with the Scorpion… it bears ill omens for the Empire, and I need to do my part to see it ended swiftly and victoriously."
designernotes: This is the Tessen used by Akodo Kano

text: Equips to Akodo Kano for 1 less Gold. You may use this Personality's Tactical Advantage ability as an Engage.
title: Kano's Tessen

flavor: The Tsuruchi sensei allow their students to view it, reverently informing them of the enemies it has thwarted and the lives it has claimed.
designernotes: This is Tsuruchi Bowmaster's Bow. Art should show him wielding it, maybe killing an enemy of the Mantis.

text:
(A Personality may only have one Weapon.)
Battle, :bow:: Ranged 3 Attack (Destroy a target enemy Follower or Personality without Followers with 3 or lower Force).
title: Master Bowman's Yumi

flavor: Born of the same forge, brothers of life and death.
designernotes: Mirumoto Higaru dual-wielding two of this Katana.

text:
As a Focus Effect, after a player wins the duel, they may discard a card to draw a card.
This Item has +1F/+1C while this Personality has another Matched Daisho or you have Compassion. (Compassion takes effect while you have fewer Provinces than anyone else.)
title: Matched Daisho

flavor: "They are completely ineffective as weapons on their own, but of course the shuriken itself is not the weapon, is it?" - Bayushi Fuyuko
designernotes: A Ninja Weapon being wielded by Shosuro Poison Master. Should be some kind of bladed weapon.

text:
After this Item enters play, lose 3 Honor.
Ninja Battle, :bow:: Bow a target enemy Personality with a Poison token or without abilities.
title: Poisoned Shuriken

flavor: "They are too heavy for a rider to carry, and awkward even for infantry. Their reinforced haft and specially built tips are more than sufficient to pierce both a horse and its rider. We will put them to good use." - Isawa Nobuo
designernotes: [Note: A Yari being used to fight off Cavalry.]

text: Will only attach to an Infantry Personality. This Personality cannot gain Cavalry. Cavalry Personalities may not move to oppose this Personality in the Engage Segment.
title: Reinforced Yari

flavor: "When one commits fully to a course of action, with no doubt or remorse in one's heart, defeat cannot be the outcome." - Akodo's Leadership
designernotes: A massive, impressive looking suit of armor.

text:
(A Personality can only have one Armor.)
Interrupt: Negate the action's Force penalties on all cards in this unit.
title: Shield of the Honored Soul

flavor: "What now, Spider?"
designernotes: Art: Closeup of a sai being used to disarm a katana, while a similar weapon in the Kensai's other hand stabs his target.

text:
Your deck may include four copies of this Item. After it attaches, dishonor its Personality.
Battle, :bow:: Fear 2 that may target Items and Spells, and may not be increased or combined except with other Swordcatchers. Return any attachments this Fear bowed to their owner's hand.
title: Swordcatcher

flavor: Outlandish, exotic, dishonorable, and dangerous for the untrained to use; weapons such as these are scorned by most samurai. Thus, most samurai are wholly unprepared to face them. The irony isn't lost upon their wielders.
designernotes: Bakuhatsugama are identical to Kusari-gama, except that the weight on the end of the chain is replaced with a fragile container that bursts on impact, usually full of contact poison. A Ninja is using it to smash poison over the head of a guard that has been tripped by the chain and brought down to their knees.

text:
After this Item enters play, lose 1 Honor.
Ninja Battle, :bow:: Bow a target enemy card. If this bowed a Personality with attachments, destroy this Item.
title: Bakuhatsugama

flavor: Scholars and philosophers alike often keep their greatest insights on simple scrolls, and contain them in simple boxes.
designernotes: Notes: A box with great power.

text:
Invest :g2:: Draw a card. (Upon being played, permanently increase the Gold Cost by the Invest cost to get the effect.)
This Personality cannot issue challenges.
Battle, :bow:: Draw a card. Discard a card.
title: Box of Mysteries

flavor: "It is not a burden to carry your clan's banner into battle. It is an honor… one that endures long after the ringing of steel fades."
designernotes: [Art Note: A sea of Lion Samurai all wearing back banners]

text:
Invest :g2:: Draw a card.
You may include any number of copies of this card in your deck. Can only attach to a Samurai without a Standard. Followers in this unit have +1F.
Battle: Fear equal to the number of Standards in this army.
title: Clan Mon

flavor: They are smaller and somewhat lighter than their kin, but can be wielded in both hands for added damage.
designernotes: Notes: Generically useful for Draft and fits into a slot unused by Polearms thus far.

text:
(You may Equip a Reserve attachment, if it would be opposed, as a Battle action.)
After this Item enters play, straighten its Personality.
Open, :bow:: If this Personality does not have a Madness token, give him or her one.
title: Light Tetsubo

flavor: Inspired by Hida Genda's preferred weapon, these hammers epitomize the Crab approach to battle. Smaller weapons cannot turn a Fist aside, and those who bear the Taint cannot bear its touch. Simple, pragmatic, and effective.
designernotes: The dai tsuchi wielded by Hida Genda.

text: Jade Battle, :bow:: Melee 3 Attack with -1 strength if the target has a Two-Handed Weapon and +1 strength if the target is Shadowlands.
title: Purity's Fist

flavor: A blade, like a name, is received from one's ancestors and is to be safeguarded for the benefit of the generations to come after.
designernotes: A katana that visibly saw multiple battles, on a family shrine. Should still inspire reverence.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
After you Equip this Item, gain 1 Honor for each Province you have destroyed this game. This Personality has +1PH.
title: Revered Blade

flavor: For formal functions, where the crude necessities of war make way for finer craftsmanship and aesthetic concerns.
designernotes: An intricately carved suit of ceremonial armor.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
This Personality has +1PH. Increase by 1 the first of your Honor gains each turn from actions from or targeting this Personality.
title: Ritual Armor

flavor: "They cut out my heart. This will cut out theirs…"
designernotes: [Art Note: Again, this is not masatane, but instead is Tetsuo's Nagamaki, or at least I am guessing the Weapon featured in his art to date is a Nagamaki. If it is not, please let Design know.]

text:
Equips to Tetsuo for 2 less Gold. After the first time each turn this Weapon bows, straighten it.
Battle, :bow:: Melee 3 Attack (Destroy a target enemy Follower or Personality without Followers with 3 or lower Force).
title: Tetsuo's Nagamaki

flavor: What many call a nunchaku is a weapon derived from a simple agricultural tool. Using such weapons is frowned upon in samurai culture. However, few can deny their effectiveness in battle.
designernotes: Art: Close up of an exquisitely built Nunchaku being used to incapacitate a Shadowlands beast.

text:
(Draw a card after you Equip a Destined card.)
After this Weapon attaches, dishonor its Personality.
Battle, :bow:: Fear 3.
title: Threshing Flail

flavor: Every suit of armor is a litany of battles won and trials endured. Some suits develop their own legends, legacies that their wearers seek to be worthy of. They live, they fight, and they pass these suits on, so the suits, like their wearers, can continue to serve their clans.
designernotes: Armor that is protective, but makes you slow and unwieldy.

text:
Actions cannot move this Personality.
Tireless Battle: Put this Item into your hand. (Tireless actions may be taken even while bowed.)
title: Weathered Armor
